sentences.english: The gentlemen pronounced him to be a fine figure of a man.
sentences.chinese: 男賓們都稱讚他的一表人材。

sentences.english: This university has created a number of prominent talents.
sentences.chinese: 這所大學造就了一批傑出的人材。

sentences.english: It is evident that you belong to the first circles.
sentences.chinese: 你毫無問題是屬於第一流的人材。

sentences.english: There are not enough trained younger men and women ready to take over from older experts.
sentences.chinese: 現在科技人材青黃不接。

sentences.english: Why is the military so bad at retaining these people?
sentences.chinese: 軍方在保留這些人材方面爲什麼做得這樣差？

sentences.english: He is an invaluable asset to the firm.
Ricky lamented the lack of high quality design talents in Mainland China in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 黃志達感概近年國內設計界缺乏具質素的設計人材。

sentences.english: They don't do any damn more molding at Pencey than they do at any other school.
sentences.chinese: 在潘西也象在別的學校一樣，根本沒栽培什麼人材。

definition: equally proficient in intellectual and military affairs
Easy to raise an army of one thousand, but hard to find a good general. (idiom)
pinyin: qian1 jun1 yi4 de2 , yi1 jiang4 nan2 qiu2

definition: a galaxy of talent (idiom)/a great number of competent people
capable person/Homo habilis, extinct species of upright East African hominid
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
solid learning/real ability and learning/genuine talent
select the best people for promotion
